_aChangeLog.text: Modified all "surf" sides, to make them walkable

_sText:
bhop_Zelda_Stone_Tower

This map is a part of the current Zombie Escape map I'm making. Its an exact replica (or almost exact) of the Stone Tower from the N64 game: The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask. 
I build everything from scratch.

Thanks to Tony Montana for his "Efficent Non-Linear Multi-Stage Map Completion" and his help when I started to learn how to rip N64 models. 

Also thanks to Frozenstate for his help with N64 ripping.


Objective

The style of the map gameplay is like in bhop_FFVII_Mako_Reactor_v2, you have to get things before you can progress. In the map, you have to press 3 switches before you can pass the stone platforms.
I couldn't make things like in the game, i.e you pressed 3 switches, and the stone platforms from below move, and create a way. That could work if the map was single player, but not multiplayer.


Put the start trigger where the "Start Timer" is. Near the edge of the hole.

Put the end trigger where the "Stop Timer" is. At the entrance of the temple.

With autobhop the map should be beatable under 1 minutes 30 s

In legit, it will take more time, but every jump is possible.


Update?

I named the map a1, in case I release a new version with the temple. 

 Anyway, I already build, the Stone Tower Temple (which you can see the 1st room in the map) and the Inverted Stone Tower Temple in Hammer. So maybe a new version of this will come after I do some alpha tests of my Zombie Escape map (which will be a reproduction of the whole Ikana) with the 2 temples.
